title: New Holland LX865 Skid Steer: How to Flush Water-Contaminated Hydraulic Oil & Prevent Future Issues.

tasks.task: Perform hydraulic reservoir draining and line flushing on a New Holland machine due to water contamination.

subtasks: Identify water contamination in hydraulic lines (white, milky oil).
Remove dipstick securely and connect pump to reservoir.
Transfer contaminated oil to a bucket using the pump.
Inspect reservoir cap and filter for proper placement and condition.
Examine gasket seals around the reservoir cap and replace as necessary.
Reinstall reservoir cap and ensure proper sealing.
Refill reservoir with clean hydraulic fluid.
Operate machine to cycle fluid through auxiliary lines.
Drain auxiliary lines into a bucket while bleeding air/faulty fluid.
Repeat fluid checks and line bleeds until only clean hydraulic fluid is present.
Install new hydraulic filter to replace contaminated one.
Seal reservoir cover with a modified container and silicone sealant.
Confirm no water contamination in fluid by visual inspection and testing.

tasks.task: Perform hydraulic reservoir draining and line flushing on a New Holland machine due to water contamination.
